question: I am a 49 year old female. Two years ago I had a DVT and was diagnosed with Factor V Leiden. Recently went to the doctor for stiff joints and just not feeling like myself ( physically and mentally ). Was diagnosed with Type I Diabetes and Hashimotos disease.I have started insulin but no treatment for the Hashimots till I finish getting my cardiac clearance. My most immediate problem I am covered from neck to ankles with a rash that has hives and postules that itch like nothing I can even explain. This rash has been going on for about 15  weeks. I have been to 3 different dermatologists and no relief. I have been treated with everything from predisone to dapsone ( for 2.5 weeks with no relief ). Was should I be getting checked for and what can I do to relief this itch....If I don't get some relief soon I may lose my mind.
title: Rash with Diabetes and Hashimotos
